title: Configure Aviator use cases
content:
The system supports a few Aviator-based use cases to empower Request, Incident, and Change management. A tenant administrator needs to complete certain configurations to enable them. 

Prerequisite

Your system has Aviator enabled and configured. See Enable Aviator and Configure Aviator.

Use case: Sentiment analysis for requests

Aviator automatically analyzes the sentiment expressed by end users in Requests. If the sentiment is negative, a business rule assigns the Request to your chosen Service Desk group, ensuring that such Requests are responded to quickly.

To enable this use case, a tenant administrator needs to complete the following tasks. 

Add a business rule

In the Agent Interface, click Administration > Studio > Processes and Rules. In the record type drop-down list, select Request, and then add the required business rule.

Event Rule Action required in Studio
After change

Description: Assign the request to the group "Service Desk"

Condition (expression): ${entity.SentimentAnalysis != null && indexof(to_lower_case(trim(entity.SentimentAnalysis)), 'negative') >=0 && entity.ServiceDeskGroup== null && tenant_settings.OT_AI_ENABLED && tenant_settings.AVIATOR_BUSINESS_RULE_ENABLED}

field values: CurrentAssignment:ServiceDesk ,  ServiceDeskGroup: <Service desk group> 

 

Example:

Assign the request to the group "Service Desk"

If ${entity.SentimentAnalysis != null && indexof(to_lower_case(trim(entity.SentimentAnalysis)), 'negative') >=0 && entity.ServiceDeskGroup== null && tenant_settings.OT_AI_ENABLED && tenant_settings.AVIATOR_BUSINESS_RULE_ENABLED}

Update the <Service desk group> placeholder with the group to which the request will be escalated.

Use case: Escalation notifications for requests

When a Request is escalated due to negative sentiment, Aviator can automatically generate an email (based on the negative portion of the request) to the requester that addresses the concerns expressed and can provide assurance that the issue is being looked into. A business rule then sends the email to the requester. 

This use case is enabled out of the box. However, in an environment upgraded from a version earlier than 24.4, a tenant administrator needs to perform the following tasks to enable this use case. 

(Upgraded environment only) Add business rules

In the Agent Interface, click Administration > Studio > Processes and Rules. In the record type drop-down list, select Request, and then add the required business rules.

Event Rule Action required in Studio
After applying changes

AVIATOR: Generate an email draft text when the sentiment is negative

 Add using comparison mode
After applying changes

AVIATOR: Send a notification drafted by Aviator when sentiment is negative 

 Add using comparison mode

Use case: Risk analysis for changes

Aviator can enable change coordinators to quickly generate a descriptive risk assessment and numerical risk score for the Change. The results are displayed in the AI risk assessment and AI risk score fields. 

To enable this use case, a tenant admin needs to perform the following steps. 

Add custom action

In the Agent Interface, click Administration > Studio > Custom actions. In the record type drop-down list, select Change, and then click + New. Configure the following custom action:

  • Name: RiskAnalysis 
  • Display Name: Risk analysis 
  • URL: none 
  • Enable workflow: enabled
  • Icon: icon-warning-sign 
  • Position in record page: Show as primary 
  • Group in record page: none
  • Position in grid page: Do not show 
  • Group in grid page: none

Add business rules

In the Agent Interface, click Administration > Studio > Processes and Rules. In the record type drop-down list, select Change, and then add the required business rules.

Event Rule Action required in Studio
After applying changes

Description: AVIATOR: Assess the risk of change when Customer trigger "RiskAnalysis" 

Condition (expression): ${entity.CustomActionName_c=='RiskAnalysis' && current_update.CustomActionCount_c.IsChanged }

field: AI risk assessment

input(optional): ${concat('Service affected:',entity.AffectsActualService, ', Change Urgency:', entity.Urgency, case_when(entity.ImpactScope,null,'', concat(', Impact Scope:', entity.ImpactScope)), case_when(entity.ScheduledDowntimeDuration, null, '', concat(', Service Downtime Duration in Seconds:', entity.ScheduledDowntimeDuration)))}

application context:  Description

Aviator model: Assess Risk  

 

Example:

AVIATOR: Assess the risk of change when Customer trigger "RiskAnalysis" 

If ${entity.CustomActionName_c=='RiskAnalysis' && current_update.CustomActionCount_c.IsChanged }

Set AI risk assessment by calling Aviator based on  ${concat('Service affected:',entity.AffectsActualService, ', Change Urgency:', entity.Urgency, case_when(entity.ImpactScope,null,'', concat(', Impact Scope:', entity.ImpactScope)), case_when(entity.ScheduledDowntimeDuration, null, '', concat(', Service Downtime Duration in Seconds:', entity.ScheduledDowntimeDuration)))} and Description using Assess Risk

template. 
After applying changes

Description: AVIATOR: Score the risk of change when Customer trigger "RiskAnalysis" 

Condition (expression): ${entity.CustomActionName_c=='RiskAnalysis' && current_update.CustomActionCount_c.IsChanged}

field: AI risk score

input(optional): ${concat('Service affected:',entity.AffectsActualService, ', Change Urgency:', entity.Urgency, case_when(entity.ImpactScope,null,'', concat(', Impact Scope:', entity.ImpactScope)), case_when(entity.ScheduledDowntimeDuration, null, '', concat(', Service Downtime Duration in Seconds:',

application context:  Description

Use case: Creating knowledge from incidents

When the Knowledge candidate option in an Incident is selected, Aviator can automatically generate a draft knowledge article title and text based on information in the Incident. This draft is saved to a new Article record that is linked to the Incident. 

Add a business rule

This use case is enabled out of the box in new installations. You need to add the business rule below to hide related fields if Aviator is disabled.

Record type Event Rule Action required in Studio
Article Rendering forms

Use case: Resolving incidents

When analyzing an Incident, agents can click the Resolve button in the Agent Interface, and Aviator will propose a solution based on information in the Incident. This solution is saved in the Solution field of the Incident. 

To enable this use case, a tenant administrator needs to perform the following tasks. 

Add custom action

In the Agent Interface, click Administration > Studio > Custom actions. In the record type drop-down list, select Incident, and then click + New. Configure the following custom action:

  • Name: Resolve 
  • Display Name: Resolve 
  • URL: none 
  • Enable workflow: enabled 
  • Icon: icon-v-green
  • Position in record page: Show as primary 
  • Group in record page: none
  • Position in grid page: Do not show 
  • Group in grid page: none

Add business rules

In the Agent Interface, click Administration > Studio > Processes and Rules. In the record type drop-down list, select Incident, and then add the required business rules.

Event Rule Action required in Studio
After applying changes

Description: AVIATOR: Generate a Solution based on the incident's Title, Description, and Comments

Condition (expression): ${ entity.CustomActionName_c=='Resolve' && current_update.CustomActionCount_c.IsChanged }   

field: Solution

input: please give me suggested solution

application context(optional): Title , Description , Comments

search text: concat(${entity.DisplayLabel}, '\n', to_plain_text(entity.Description))

user: ${entity.AssignedPerson}

variables(optional): leave blank

Aviator model: Suggest solution for an Incident ticket 

 

Example:

AVIATOR: Generate a Solution based on the incident's Title, Description, and Comments

If ${ entity.CustomActionName_c=='Resolve' && current_update.CustomActionCount_c.IsChanged }   
Set  Solution by calling Aviator based on please give me suggested solution, Title Description Comments , concat(${entity.DisplayLabel}, '\n', to_plain_text(entity.Description)) that ${entity.AssignedPerson} can access, and variables(optional) using Suggest solution for an Incident ticket 

 Add manually by using the Call Aviator with record and search data
template.

actions: Resolve (Custom action)

 

Example:

If  ${ ! tenant_settings.OT_AI_ENABLED || ! tenant_settings.AVIATOR_BUSINESS_RULE_ENABLED  }

 Add manually by using the Hide actions template.
